location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘13. Shaikh Saad and Kut-Al-Amara. Situation 22nd December 1916’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:368 x 655 mm, on sheet 461 x 723 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Heliozincographed at the Survey of India Offices, Dehra Dun. Simla Drawing Office, No. 3942, March 1925. S.D.O. 3936.Distinctive Features:Map of Shaikh Saad and Kut-Al-Amara [Al-Kūt] compiled from ground and air reconnaissance, produced to illustrate the movements of the British and the Turkish military forces on the 22nd December 1916. Shows the location of troops, trenches and lines of advance with positions of headquarters indicated by symbols and explained in a key at the upper right hand corner. The Tigris line of defences also marked.Map overprinted with numeric reference grid.Same base map as IOR/L/MIL/17/15/72/2, f 1.
